text: Takes forever to get prescriptions filled was told 20 minutes had to wait over 45 minutes car backed up at drive thru

name: Debra Colbert
text: A variety of goods and very clean place to visit.

name: Debra West
text: Wish I could have left 0 stars. Had surgery this morning and dropped off my prescription at 2 pm they told me it would be 5 before it was ready it's now 10 minutes until 6 and it's STILL not ready. Very rude customer service also. Last trip there for me!

name: Tonya Harvey
text: I hate this store, lines are too long, takes forever!!

name: Twizty X
text: Used this Pharmacy for many years had a few issues though none of them major

name: Rafael M
text: Ok

name: Matthew Blevins
text: I went to this Walgreens to drop off a Fedex package and the cashier at the front of the store was friendly and helpful however the lady in the photo department in charge of receiving packages was rude and didn’t want to help. She told me “she didn’t have any space left to hold my package” and then ended up taking the package anyways after she sighed and reluctantly took it. I told her thanks for the help and she just mumbled “mhm” while not looking at me at all and just walked off. Not a very good employee.

name: Suresh Mathews
text: Driver’s beware: This is a review for the Drive-through pharmacy pick-up. Friendly staff at the window; fairly quick service. If paying by cash the change is returned in an envelope - all great. But, drivers beware of your car/SUV driver’s side tire scraping the sides of the concrete. It happened to me couple times, and the second time was scary loud that I thought my tire ripped. Fortunately, it was fine. The exit out of the drive through is narrow and curves left; and therefore the tire scraping the concrete. It appears that this happens to every driver that is unaware of the lurking danger. I called and made a complaint with the Manager but there have been en changes yet to the drive through. I’ve educated myself that i need to turn my wheel to the right as I exit out and then lean left into the turn. This way the driver’s side rear wheel gets more space and avoids scraping the concrete.

name: Eli Rowe
text: I got double charged for some OTC Walgreens brand Naproxen. It was $7.00 something per bottle and one bottle plus a pack of M&M’s and the total came to $16.00 something. Didn’t answer phone when I tried to call to fix issue.

name: Alan Manning
text: This pharmacy and its staff are completely incompetent. I called asking why they and several other Walgreens stores have absolutely no supplies of the medicine which I've easily been able to purchase from them in the past and can just as easily purchase from any other pharmacy, and they had not the slightest clue. They were also incredibly rude and not helpful AT ALL. It's not like Walgreens doesn't carry this medication either, as I've been able to purchase it at other Walgreens locations in the past, and it is a prescription medication.

name: Brandon Yates
text: We have used this pharmacy for several months. We have had a great experience each visit. They even gave our dog a treat. They are very friendly here.

name: Mia Tucker
text: The staff are polite and helpful!

name: Michael Lane
text: The pharmacy people are the worst! They say they are filling your script. NO you show up and the act like you ever dropped off! Had to wait another day for my meds. AVOID AT ALL COSTS!!!!

name: Christie Musso Bruce
text: We have always used Walgreens for our prescriptions. We moved and started using this location about 6 months ago. I have never seen such rude people in the pharmacy in my life. None of them are friendly, never say thank you or nothing. They act like your bothering them when you pull up to get your medicine. It’s been an issue since we’ve moved here. We will be looking for another pharmacy.

name: McKenzie Middleton
text: Moved my prescription today due to this pharmacy's incompetence. My first run in with them was I had a Dr. back home and they refused to fill the prescription bc the dr was from out of town. But I took it to Walmart and they had no issues filling it. The 2nd run in was after i had surgery and the tech was extremely rude. I asked what the hold up was, thinking they may need to see my license or insurance and he responded "there isn't a hold up i told you it would be 15 minutes and it hasn't been." Then this last time they were going to charge me $194 for a monthly prescription,  I told them I couldn't afford that and had the dr call me in the same prescription to CVS, it was $0 and covered fully by my insurance. Will not go back.

name: Charlotte Collins
text: Pharmacy Staff is slow, rude and lazy. Seems like the most miserable place around to work. No one smiles or even remotely acts like they want to help you. I will be moving my rx needs to another pharmacy. Thank goodness the rest of the employees are very friendly and courteous. The pharmacy needs some serious attitude adjusting.

name: Diane Natale
text: It's a hit or miss. Some of the techs can get extremely rude and think that they are the pharmacists. Sometimes pharmacy can be very helpful. You just never know.

name: Sissy Smith
text: They RARELY, if EVER, even answer the phone at this location?! TWO WORDS: BAD. MANAGEMENT.

name: Eric Lawman
text: The store is great up until you get to the pharmacy. Every time I try to do anything with them either they don’t have the medication or the system is constantly down. So it’s either pay cash and get reimbursed later or wait for who knows how long for the system to come back up. I’ll shop here but I’m gonna find a new pharmacy to use.

name: Caleb Wilson
text: Every employee has always been helpful to me

name: Julia Thomason at Love the Mouse Travel
text: This my "go to" Walgreens. The staff is always very friendly and helpful. The pharmacy used to be 24 hours but now closes at 10:00pm. If the pharmacy was still 24 hours I would have given them 5 stars.

name: Renee B
text:
Friendly Staff.
Great selection of allergy/cold/flu items in various brands.
The cutest theme/holiday gifts and decorations.
Every time we visit we're greeted with a smile.
Pharmaceutical Techs are knowledge and always ready to answer any questions we have and they do a great job explaining the meds.
Come back around Mother's Day for the perfect little something!

name: Robert key
text: Very rude an treat you like your a criminal, someome with a drug problem or poor! Very discriminatory the way those people in the pharmacy act especially lead pharmacist

name: Talia Ledbetter
text: Really sweet, accommodating pharmacy staff! Highly recommend.

name: Talia Ledbetter
text: Really sweet, accommodating pharmacy staff! Highly recommend.

name: Steven Hughes
text: Fed up with their incompetence.  Never again.

name: Jonathan Perez
text: I was told by one the ladies in the pharmacy department my medication would be ready by a certain time. I showed up a little late just in case they had been backed up. I show up and my order hadn't even been put in the system. O get asked by the young lady who took my order. I describe to her the person. She goes in the back and asks on of them. They loudly start mocking me saying did I just pick a random description. I mentioned to her when she got back that it was not a random description. The other women started laughing at the fact that I overheard. No level of professionalism shown here by them.

name: Natalie Chambers
text: I will personally never step back into this Walgreens again. My fiance and I went in there tonight and noticed one of the workers kept watching us. I didn't think anything of it at first but, she followed us outside. We asked her was there a problem she said no. But, wrote down our tag number. I have never felt so disrespected at a store in my life. I've never had a problem at Walgreens before. As ststed before I will never step back into this Walgreens again.

name: Taylor Ivins
text: I have only ever used the drive thru. My experience there varies. At times, I feel valued and am cheerily greeted by an employee who seems to genuinely care and enjoy their job. Other times, I am not greeted at all for several minutes while the employee types away on their computer (more than one of the employees do this). It’s not hard to quickly pick up the drive thru line and say “Welcome, I’ll be with you in just a moment” and carry on. As a customer, it does not leave a good impression when you are neglected. Typically the wait time is incredibly long, even if my prescription is filled and ready to go. I will continue to use this Walgreens because my insurance switched its contract from CVS and it is the closest location to me. But I will advise my friends and family against going here. The employees here need reinforced training on customer interaction.

name: Matt Morris Sr
text:
Best Walgreens ever The service here is Stellar... Pharm. Matt is Awesome
.....As are the rest of the staff !!!!!! Surprised i am the first to do a review....Love this store!

name: mahmoud suleiman
text: I will never go back again rude pharmacy staff prescription never ready when they tell you is going to be ready their system always having problem-connecting with insurance they just lost me and my wife and my five kids

name: Martha Pack
text: Horrible! Pharmacist very, very RUDE!

name: Valerie Harris
text: The pharmacy guys are terrible!!!

name: JC Minton
text: Love this location! Was disappointed when they started closing the pharmacy at midnight.

name: Kayla Johnson
text: I had my husbands company name printed on a sweatshirt and it turned out PERFECT!!! This was a last minute Christmas gift and I placed my order on Dec 17th. While others wanted to charge me $85 for a rushed fee, she did not charge me nearly that much! She gave me a VERY fair price and did great work! I was very impressed! I will forever use Trifecta for all my printing needs from now on!

name: Chenequa Farrar
text: I have purchased 3 masks from her and the quality and comfortably of the masks are perfect and reasonable pricing. I wear my mask all the time. I get a lot of compliments about my mask. Winsome is Bomb.com. If you are looking for a mask that you can breath out of and comfortable contact her she has superior products.

name: Ariel Willis
text:
I had Winsome Paperie make my invitation suite. I loved how they came out and the special touch with the coral paper was perfect.

She also made the menus for the reception.

There were minor hiccups do to unforeseen circumstances which caused the loss of a star but overall the quality of work is great.

name: mark drost
text: works wonders with my project ideas--

name: Bryn Ealy
text: As a medical professional, I can say that I’ve never had another medical colleague speak to me so condescendingly over the phone. My patient was out of state on vacation and unfortunately was having severe pain in a tooth we had recently done a root canal on. I sent prescriptions for an antibiotic and pain medication for the patient. The patient called me after hours stating that the pharmacy wouldn’t allow her to have the narcotic and that I needed to call them myself to verify the prescription. When I spoke with the pharmacist on staff, she berated me for trying to transfer a controlled substance from another Walgreens. I questioned if her e-prescribe was comparable with my dental software, and she basically told me to kick rocks. The prescription ended up going through, but from the sounds of it, she was also very rude to my patient. For someone whose job is literally to help patients obtain medication in order to feel better, this pharmacist clearly had no interest.  Disappointed in the care given to someone clearly in pain and not drug-seeking. My patient is not the first person in the world to have ever had a toothache while away from their regular dentist. She won’t be the last.

name: Erik Newby
text: Can’t speak to picking up prescriptions, but the store itself is well stocked with friendly staff. Found everything I needed and more.

name: Amanda E
text: The pharmacist last night was great at helping me with ear drops for my son! The prescription was filled fast and helpful with all of our questions.

name: Debbie Shumock
text: Had a terrible experience at the photo counter. Very rude lady. My order was late being processed and I didn’t receive all if my pictures. When I returned to get them one of them was awful. The color and clarity was terrible. They had to change something on the machine and I believe that caused the issue. I told the lady, Linda I believe is her name, the picture was fine on my phone. She refused to reprint saying the picture is what it is.  I had to toss it in the garbage.

name: Stacy Johnson
text: I had a great experience compared to other people's reviews. I am from out of state, needed a prescription and then a prior authorization called in from my doctor, and Drew in the pharmacy went above and beyond to get me the medicine I needed to help me feel better. Couldn't have asked for better!

name: Alex Elizabeth
text:
Dropped off a prescription right when they opened at 9 am and it’s now 6 pm. Went to pick it up and come to find out they were out of stock. I never got a phone call regarding the issues. According to the lady they were “too busy” there was no one there and she was very rude.

If you need a prescription filled I would go to CVS.

name: Wen Ka
text: Supper friendly pharmacy staff.

name: Nancy Johnstone
text: Not nice pharmacists! When I brought blood-pressure prescription to be filled there, they said my health insurance card doesn’t cover that and they would charge me $54 for 90-day supply - CASH only(!). I wasn’t sure prescription was generic but not helpful the pharmacists that didn’t even ask me if I wanted generic ones or whatever. I left there without picking them up. Went to another one for only $15 for 90-day supply even it covers my health insurance! Cash or card!

name: riley m
text: I went here to get some child melatonin and i had a question and i was at the pharmacy for easily 20 minutes waiting to get my question answered. There were 3 of them in the pharmacy and they didn’t pay any attention to me

name: James Gentry
text: Pick a different Walgreens. Wish we had read the reviews before going to the WORST Walgreens ever!! Took 4 hours to fill an  amoxicillin prescription. They wouldn't give us our prescription through the drive-thru for some reason so we had to bring our sick kids into the store. The people that run the store need to be fired immediately what an embarrassment to Walgreens.

name: James Meadlock
text: Friendly staff, but... I am prescribed a medication and insurance pays for 2/3's of it; they will not fill the whole prescription and let me pay for my third on the same day; I have to make an extra trip each month.  Stupidity makes me mad.

name: Ramey Holsten
text: The customer service at this store is TERRIBLE!! If you have a sick child please find a different pharmacy. They close up to walk out at 9 pm and do not open until 9:10.

name: Trecarya Mitchell
text:
I dropped a prescription off at 8:34pm on yesterday.  The system told me it would be ready 7:34 this morning. I went to pick it up,  and I was told it wasn't ready.  I just called back to get info on pickup.  They told me I couldn't have it ready by 12 unless I come wait in the store for an hour.  They entered it twice which slowed it down.  They made the error.  Why wouldn't you accommodate me? I shouldn't have to make
three trips to pick up one prescription.  I definitely plan to file a complaint with the company.

name: Angel Reyes Tarafa
text: Pharmacy needs to get organized,  I when a week with out my heart  medication

name: Michelle Howard
text: THIS IS THE WORST PHARMACY EVER!! They take forever to do anything.. Takes them days to fill anything.. drive-thru is ridiculous.. I hate this Walgreens with a fiery passion.. get your medicine filled somewhere else.. they also 9/10 times never have the medication but you’ll wait over an hour to get to the window in store and twice as long in the drive-thru.. this place is a joke

name: Matthew Potenza
text: Pharmacy and photo. No stars. Do not recommend .

name: Dorothy Wright
text: I love the convenience of being able to get over counter medicine quickly plus prescription meds as well

name: WonderWoman 1986
text: They sometimes have nice staff but they never fill medicine on time, it's an absurd time frame all the time, medicine is literally never ready. Lucky to get the 3 stars from me, it's only bc I'm friendly

name: keron Batson
text: Instead of serving customers in the Drive-thru, workers are shopping and and talking to each other. While I’m sitting at the window for over 30 minutes with no one even bothering to attend to me.

name: Victoria Edwards
text: I can't stand how long it takes this place to fill medications. It does not matter if it's called in at opening you probably can not get it to your hands til that night. They should read these reviews and hire additional staff.

name: Tammy Phillips
text: The most rudest Pharmacy I've ever seen.  Takes hours to get someone to even answer phone.  Then the pharmacist talks to you HORRIBLE.  Will never go back there.

name: Shay Rodriguez
text: Never fill your medication on time. Even after you get a email notification, go to get it and it isn't there, and go again. The wait is 45 mins minimum in line to even get to the window. This is the worst pharmacy I've ever used.

name: Kountry_bow_ Keith
text: Good place for a  squatted truck meet

name: Randal Roberts
text: Absolutely absurd how long it takes to receive servicr via the pharmacy drive through. I'm guessing it's a staffing issue. It's unfortunate, because the remainder of the store is a pleasant experience.

name: Melissa Taylor
text: They have the worse pharmacy I have ever had to deal with they never answer the phone they are extremely slow. Bye taking my business to Walmart.

name: Jessica Hill
text:
The line in side today August 10th is extremely long , the lady that's working the widow with the brown hair rather stand and wait on drive  thru . There
was no one at drive-thru she just standing there waiting on cars to drive up LoL

name: Ashley Johnson
text: Worst pharmacy between Columbus and Phenix City. I can never get through to the Pharmacy. They never answer their phones.

name: Shakeidra Logan
text: The absolute worst! Every time you call, the wait is over 25 minutes and they just hang up! And the express line is a joke. You have to wait in the (always) long line with everyone. Most of the techs ignore you and have casual conversations, but look at you like you made them choose the career.

name: Christine Edgar
text: I always have great customer service. Yes I have to wait at the pharmacy but I already know that I will have to do this. It’s a busy place.

name: Toni Michelle
text: Terrible customer service. I was left waiting an hour past my pick up time for my card I ordered. All because the girl working there never printed it. And then couldn’t even find it once it was printed and it’s now 10pm might I note.. I’m extremely aggravated. The store is not busy so why am I still waiting such a long time for one little birthday card ?? She was not prompt. She was not apologetic. She is not an asset to that company at all. And it’s because of piss poor employees like herself that I will spend my money else where and tell everyone I know to do the same! Quality customer care really does go a long way. And they just don’t have any.

name: Kayleigh Bowers
text: On hold for 25 minutes, then hung up on. Called back, spoke to someone who transferred me somewhere else only to be hung up on again. Called back a third time, on hold for 10 minutes before someone picked up. They transferred me to someone else who transferred me to a never ending ringing phone which eventually hung up on me again. Absolutely useless customer service.

name: Effie Carrington
text: Wish there were less stars.  Don't know what to think of a store which will accept a call, tell caller there are 2 calls in advance of you, then one 1 call in advance of you, then keep you on hold for 25 minutes, 26 seconds, and HANG UP ON YOU.  Trying to find out about a prescription that I was to have available at noon today, it now being nearly 7:00 pm.

name: Christopher Williams
text:
Worst pharmacist and customer service I have ever dealt with. My wife had surgery and we dropped off 5 prescription slips at around  1645 We were told it would be ready at 1830.

We went to the store at 1830 we were told that they had not been filled any of the prescription and to have a seat, 30 min later they said there was an issue with one of medications and they would have to call the doctor in order to fill the pain medication. I provided them the doctor number which they didn't call, I left the store and got ahold of the doctor who inturn called the store. After talking with the store he then called back at 2032 and said that everything was straightened out and that they would fill the prescription. Went back to the store at at 2103 they had asked if we could come back in 15 min that they just got off the phone with the Doctor (which was a false statement they had gotten off the phone around 30 to 40 min prior). Finally got the pain prescription around 2133. The surgery was over at 1200 and was able to take first pain meds at 2140. Every interaction I had with them they acted as if did not care. When I asked questions they seems extremely bothered and annoyed that I would even inquire on what the issue was. I just hope that another consumer doesn't have to go through what we went through.

I would STRONGLY recommend not using this walgreens to get a prescription filled especially if you are counting on them for customer service (a caring attitude and a quick filling of a prescription). It is truly just the employees that work in the pharmacy.(I was not the only person that was struggling with getting medication, I witnessed two our families having issues as well).

To be fair the rest of the store clerks I worked with were extremely helpful and polite. I normally don't make comments but it was so bad I really hope nobody else has to go through this type of treatment.

name: Christina Clayton
text: Every single time I am in here it takes entirely too long. The staff either needs to be trained to be more productive in a faster time or they need more employees on hand. Either way, having to wait in line for over 20 minutes is absurd. Not to mention we already tried to come earlier in the day and left because the line was so backed up then too.

name: Lori Verga
text: Love this place! Every team member does exceptional work and truly cares about customers.

name: ZULK THE GREAT
text: Pharmacy is very very very slow!

name: A Colwell
text: Jacob in the pharmacy is great! I needed a prescription for my son and another pharmacy dropped the ball on it after having it for a week. Then I found out that they couldn't even get it. I called Walgreens to transfer the prescription and see if they could get the item for me. Jacob was very nice, helpful, and kept me informed. He got everything transferred quickly, was able to locate the item, and it even came in the next day.

name: Kristie Robb
text: Terrible customer service. Pharmacy is a joke (wasn’t waiting on a prescription). Just wanted some allergy meds & the line was half way across the store. They expect you to wait in that line just to get some simple Allegra D. They need more pharmacy help if that’s the way they sell regular allergy meds.

name: Deborah Watkins
text: Don’t fill when they tell you a time

name: Michael Mitchum
text: If you are getting your medicine filled here and need them to call and get your prescription transferred save yourself the trouble and don't. The employees seem to not care about the patients and only care about themselves. I spoke with Kelly and she is very condescending with me and made it seem like she was doing me a favor by trying to call to get my prescription instead of it being her job.

name: lorrie taylor
text: Switched to this pharmacy to keep from having to go to the one I normally go to in Eufaula, they are very helpful when you have questions, great customer service and open 24 hrs and they will let you know when busy times are so you don't have to wait, unlike Eufaula pharmacy you wait every time, I will do the drive to get the professional service

name: Angelica Leadabrand
text: I'm giving this Walgreen's location five stars because of the extremely helpful & courtous employees.  I go to this Walgreen's 1-3 times per week when I just need to "pick up a few things" & don't want to deal with the hassle of a big store.  I cannot recall a time when I have not been greeted by an employee as I enter the front door.  Employees always ask if I need assistance when they notice me looking around for something.  Not only will they walk with me to the item's location, but they will assist me to the cosmetics counter where they will ring up my items without me having to wait in line at the main register.  That being said, it is obvious that whoever manages this store puts customer satisfaction first & does an excellent job at instilling that belief in their employees.

name: Mrs Cricket
text:
I started at the drive thru and after waiting in line I find out there was an insurance problem. The gentleman working the drive thru didn't know what the details were so I went inside and stood in line to figure out the problem. Finally at checkout when they needed my id that it is naturally in the car. At this point I'm just done; I leave. 3 hours and no prescription. Yes I could have gotten my id and waiting again but I chose not to. They were under staffed and it was now peak time.

The prescription was dropped off and given a pickup time. It wasn't ready. I believe because of the insurance problem but I'm guessing because it was never said. A simple phone call could have helped this situation.

You want to purchase the same item from another Walgreens store or online, but you realize the system assumes you used the coupon and doesn't offer the same coupon. I had this issue several times. Once, one of my orders was canceled because of the same reason, but I saw the product at the shelf in the same day. Walgreens's online system has a lot of problems. Waste of time!

Then, he proceeded to follow me around the store about 15 feet away; not to help find what I needed, but to either act like I was going to steal or rush me out. He followed me all the way back to the register and sat there sighing until I could leave. I will literally never give that Walgreens another penny.

name: Carl Klimah
text:
READ BOTTOM LINE AT END if you don't want to read this paragraph.

I have had mixed experiences at this store. The STORE part is fine.

The PHARMACY is another story. I have had mixed experiences with them, from some pharmacists being competent and outstanding, to some being downright rude and dumb. I tutored/ taught organic chemistry when I was an undergrad and have had many arguments with them over medication. I have had them get my dosages wrong many times (telling me to take to much). On top of this many times they treated me like I was a criminal for trying to get medicines with no street value. Other times those medicines that did have street value, were handed over to me like candy. Some of the employees also were not aware of basic pharmacy policy, upon which I had to remind them of. Needless to say many of them can be rude when you question there blatant incompetence.

BOTTOM LINE: go during peak hours. Know what and how much to take. Then double check when you get home. Remain calm through the rudeness or plan on taking your business else where.

name: Gabrielle Griffith
text: I was on a family vacation and had to refill a medication I forgot at home. After ringing up I was informed that a prescription had raised from a $0 co-pay to $100. This came as a big shock and my mind was wheeling with trying to figure out how to afford that each month. The staff at the pharmacy informed me to call my insurance and make sure something was not incorrect and were very patient while I did so. This was all happening at the end of their shift. The new co-pay was the correct amount and luckily my family was able to help cover the cost. Fast forward to a few days later and I received a phone call from Walgreens patient care. The pharmacy staff had contacted them on my behalf to enroll me in to a co-pay assistance program through the medication manufacture. The new total monthly cost would be $20! They also applied the discount to the original refill and I was able to give my family back the money I had borrowed to cover the medication. I am truly thankful to the staff at the Fort Payne, AL location for all the help and kindness they showed an out-of-towner. Walgreens will always have my business.

text: TERRIBLE service at the pharmacy. We tried to use their location because our child had an issue after regular hours on a Sunday and our regular pharmacy was closed. She tried to make us go inside to present our prescription (after waiting in the drive-thru for 20 minutes) and we explained to her that we were dropping off, she said it would be 2 hours wait for a simple common antibiotic (no mixing - just pills). We left the prescription and told them we'd just have to come back the next day, it was late and the kids needed to get to bed. We had to call the Drs office and get them to send the Rx to our regular pharmacy. name: UnbiasedReport
text: No reason why I should be up so late, but I am to do this review. Customer service in the pharmacy is non existent. At 11:10 PM I turned in my prescription, was not met with kindness, and treated even worse when I told the pharmacist that I did not have health insurance. She told me it would be about 15 to 20 minutes before my prescription was ready. I asked her where did I need to go or did I need to just come back? She said well you can't sit here. You can drive over there and wait. I did so and in turn while I was waiting fell asleep. I just happened to wake up and looked at my clock and it read Midnight. I was literally across from the window. I proceeded to call and find out what was the hold up with my prescription because I did not receive a text message alert stating that it was ready. The automated system told me that I had a prescription ready.  upset at this point I went to the window and I told the lady that no one told me my prescription was ready. In turn she told me that the girl tried to wave me down. I was directly across from the window asleep in the car or as far as she could have assumed was dead from just sitting there. She had no concern at all. They have my number on file and did not use it. Nor was I sent a text message letting me know that my prescription was ready. She the pharmacist then asked if I wanted instructions instead of volunteering the instructions. I did not answer from being so upset that my time was wasted. I will not be going back. I will let others know that this Pharmacy is at the corner of rude and rude.

text: This place is very good at consistency... they are very consistently horrible. I hate to even give them ONE star. Every prescription we've ever had to get filled here is always late- like over an hour when your doctor has called it in the day before, OR they click on their keyboard and tell you that they have received nothing from your doctor, when you know that they have. We have also had them call us to tell us that a prescription was ready, only to get there, and they tell us that it is backordered and out of stock. The techs are extremely rude- I've witnessed eye-rolls and dramatic sighs (not just at myself but also other patients), and they don't seem to be very efficient at their jobs. The ONLY reason we EVER use this place is because they are the only 24-hour pharmacy in the area. If it weren't for that, we would never ever return our business here.

C’mon Walgreens, these are your ambassadors to the public. Train them to be nice. Your pharmacist is great! Have them shadow her.

text: since Walgreens is closer I called to check if there are paid water refill booths like we get in publiX and Walmart since, and the customer service said there are water fountains in the rest room and cut the call... So rude!!!

name: K
text: I have been using this pharmacy for several years. I have had just a few minor negative experiences during this time. Most of the time I was comfortable with the service. Today was a different story. I called about an hour before they closed to finalize 2 scrip. orders. I called at this time because I had tried several times in the past week and today to get thru to someone on the phone, but had too long of a hold time each time. I thought it might be less busy at 7pm. The woman who answered, who I believe was the pharmacist on duty, had a disrespectful tone a couple of times during the call. I mentally excused her then drove to pick up my orders almost immediately. When I arrived the assistant, who was one of the distasteful encounters I've witnessed in the past, was working the drive thru. I told her I needed the pills cut in the required dose which I'd gotten done many times before without problems. It usually doesn't take very long to do as well. I went to wait across the lot when I saw a multitude of cars arriving at the drive thru right before closing time. 15 or so minutes had elapsed and it was closing time by that time so I decided to drive back over to the window to pick up my meds. When I arrived the tech ignored me for about a minute or 2 and then she mouthed something to me without the microphone and immediately walked away out of my sight. I could not make out what she said, of course. I continued to wait patiently. Within that time the pharmacist walked over and in a scolding tone told me to tell her ahead of time I needed them cut. I informed her I did not because I was informed in the past not to do that because I must pay for them before they are cut. She then continued her scolding by telling me "Well it's just so late." Omg...are you not still open for business when I arrived 15 to 20 minutes prior? And it doesn't take that long to cut them. And I would of done it sooner if I could of gotten someone on the telephone without a long hold time every time I called! That response was rude, unprofessional and unfair and I did nothing wrong. How dare her and that tech or whatever she is treat a good customer this way. I have always been fair and courteous to the staff. I have already found another pharmacy and will pull my business out of there tomorrow. Thanks for reading) Hope this helps!

name: matthew Mccullough
text:
Everytime I use the automatic phone serrvice to order refills, there is always a problem and at least one isn't filled and I have to wait for them to fill it or have to come back!!! On Wednesday August 24, 2017, I called automatic phone service to order my desvenlafaxine and the recording said "we recently tried to call you to see if you wanted your armodafinil  its due to be refilled" I said yes, so it was to be ready after 11am that day. I got to the pharmacy and they said that I didn't have anything!!! I told her what I had ordered so she said I'll get it fixed, it will take a few minutes! When it was ready, she said she only had part of meds in stock and would have to order it!!!! I took the partial prescriptions and left. Thursday I called and asked were the meds in and the lady said yes. I got there and only one was available. When I questioned her about the other medication she said it didn't come in. That night I called and spoke with a lady and asked her what time my meds would be there, cause I was going to Florida at 9am the following medicine, she said it would be after 10am. I told her I was leaving to go to Florida at 9am the next day. I then asked "why is it taking so long after you ordered it to come in? She said it's because it's a narcotic. So I went on to Florida. Now I had already received 5 pills, and you would think that they would have been on the look out for it!!!!!! so when I got home Monday I went to Walgreens to pick up meds, GUESS WHAT?????? NO MEDS!!!!!!!!! She had not explanation on invoice of why meds did not come in!!!!! And now I'm being told it will be in tomorrow.....we'll see!!!!!!!
Update: I called to check to see if my medicine came in and the lady said no it still hasn't come in!!!!!! She said I'm going to give it one more day...I interrupted her and said tomorrow makes a week since you first ordered it and she said "it's because it's a narcotic (?)!!!!! I'm not a dummy, I don't know what they are doing but I will be changing pharmacies!!!!!!!

He said no when u say come back they put people n store first but that makes no sense ..even makes no sense when i was there at 10:34 am but says script didnt go in until 12:08!! name: Andrew Phillips
text: Ordered a canvas Friday online. Pick up was set for Sunday @ 8:00am. I called at 9:00 to ask if it was ready. They told me yea! I went at 1:00 and the lady couldn’t find it, called someone else to the front, she said it never printed but she would print it now. After 3 tries she says something is wrong with the printer, and it’s not going to work. She seemed to have no idea what she was doing. I asked her if I call back later, would someone be able to tell me if it was actually ready this time, or would I waist another trip up here? She told me I could just cancel my order. So I did... Went to Walmart and they printed my canvas right then and there.

name: April Renfro
text: Tried to pick up my daughters refill (which she was emailed a reminder) I gave the info to Jennifer at the drive thru window she not so politely informed the insurance was denied bc she’s not eligible until April 21. I explained this is a refill so that didn’t make sense it was just a 30 day supply. Jennifer was very rude not offering to assist in the situation at hand. She kept saying I don’t know what you want me to do. I said maybe someone made a mistake and keyed it in incorrectly that I am the one that picked it up and verified what it was. She continued to talk over me and tell me maybe it was misplaced. I assured her it wasn’t she first told me she didn’t see any record of my daughter EVER filling a prescription at that location ( she has been filling there for over a year) after insisted she told me it was filled in February and a 90 days supply again I tried to explain she continued to talk over me and be very very rude would not help me at all. I explained people make mistakes she stated “Not here we would be fired so maybe you misplaced it” I tried calling the store after I left to speak to the manager about my experience and was left on hold for several minutes and put on hold again I hung up and left this review.

I am from out of state and I feel as though this was completely unacceptable as this medication was for a thin 6 year old child. If the medication was given at the dosage which was written on the bottle then he would have ended up with more severe symptoms then he had been to the ER with in the first place. I can guarantee if I come up to Daleville again I will never go to this Walgreens.

text: If i could give this walgreens a negative star i would! i always use walgreens so i didn’t think this one would be much different. i had a prescription for my 2 month old son sent over last thursday, they said the medicine would be on monday because they had to order it, which is fine. monday i come to pick his prescription up and they couldn’t find it for 10 mins. finally after they found it they said it wasn’t done yet to come back in 30 mins. i cone back later and they said that they were waiting on an approval from a doctor. well it is tuesday now and they have ordered the wrong medication. i will never return here. my son has really bad acid reflux and is in an extreme amount of pain so this medicine is very important for him. will never return here ever

name: Ronald Rupert
text: I've been going to this Walgreens pharmacy for many years, but today is the last day.  There was a problem with one of my prescriptions and they could only give me a partial amount until they restocked.  That's annoying, but not too bad.  The remainder will be ready in a few days.  A week later my wife went in to pick them up.  They had done nothing and the prescription showed as completed.  They said they would order and the pills would be available in two days.  I went back 3 days later and they didn't have them and they hadn't been ordered.  People at the counter where trying to be helpful, but the Pharmacist clearly didn't care.  No, "I'm sorry", no engagement at all.  They finally told me they would order and to come back in two days.  I went back in 3 days later.  The pills are now in stock, but nobody had filled the remainder of my prescription and the system was still showing that it was completed.  The person working the counter was helpful and apologetic, but when the Pharmacist came back, she said "we don't manufacture the pills, so it's not out fault".  She obviously missed the training for customer service.  This was the fourth time I was told the prescription would be filled and it still wasn't done.  An apology, at a minimum, should have given, but I surely didn't expect to get attitude.  Completely unprofessional.  I told them not to fill my prescription and I left and will not return.  I'm transferring my prescriptions to CVS later today.

name: Fair Reviews
text: I have worked at Walgreens.  I know the rules and they are stretching them at the pharmacy.  The attendant in drive thru was rude.  It took a very long time for him to come to the window.  Then he said it would take 20 min fill the prescription and I should come back.  I timed the cars ahead of me.  One was more than 15 min.  One was over 20 min.  I recommend corporate and store manager look into it.  Until the young man's attitude is fixed go somewhere else.  I will be praying for him.

name: Margaret Anne Parker
text: Minus 50+ stars for this pharmacy. It's a pharmacy, first and foremost in the business to take care of a patient's needs by filling doctor prescribed medication for sick people. That alone should mean the employees will be kind, considerate, and have the patient's best interest at heart, which requires a certain level of customer service skills. I can honestly say, this is by far the WORST customer service experience I've ever had, in ANY industry! From the pharmacist herself to the tech working the counter, they are the rudest people I've encountered! My particular issue began with a refill which I called in back in August. Once I received a text that it was ready for pickup, I drove over to collect it, only to be told once I got there that the RX was not ready and the drug was not in stock. The tech argued with me about being notified that it was ready until I showed her the text message and then she had nothing to say. I was then told they would call me when the drug was back in stock and my RX had been filled. Three weeks went by and no word so I drove back over to check on it. This time, I spoke with the pharmacist who literally could not be bothered with my questions about when I might be able to get my prescription. She said it was ordered from the 'warehouse' and that they would call me when it came in but if I didn't want to wait, I could go somewhere else and get them to transfer the RX. I opted to wait. Huge mistake! Yesterday, while picking up 2 other prescriptions, I inquired about my refill on backorder. I explained everything that had taken place thus far to the tech and gave her my previous RX bottle for informational purposes. She checked on the computer and said 'this RX has already been filled.' And so I say to her, no, as I so painstakingly explained, it was never filled because you were out of the drug and could not fill it and I've been waiting for you guys to call me when it came in. Immediately she became combative! Then she tells me that, yes, they have the drug in now, BUT, I can't have it because 'oh look, this refill expired a few weeks ago.' Umm. No, it didn't 'expire,' it's been in your system awaiting the restock of the drug! She very rudely tells me that I'll have to go see my dr (and pay the $30 copay,) and obtain a new prescription. What? I'm in disbelief at this point. And when I asked if she heard any of what I had said to her previously, she began talking over me saying it's not their fault because they're all new and training and learning the rules and I'm out of luck! And that she would be happy if I took my prescriptions elsewhere! DONE! Not to worry! WALGREEN'S will never get my business again for anything!

name: stephen clanton
text: Totally lacks customer service, in addition, they always say we have to order that prescription and then you never hear back again...when you call to ask if it is in, it’s like they don’t know anything about it

name: Claudia Carson
text: Worst pharmacy experience ever! First off, it took and hour and 15 minutes to fill one prescription and then I paid online to save time (like the service advertises). When I pulled through drive thru with my toddler and infant in the car the pharmacy tech tells me that my total is blank amount...I proceed to tell her that I already paid. She then tells me that since I paid online, I had to come inside the store to get my child’s medicine. I begged her to help me out since I had both my toddler and infant in the car but she just told me the same thing again. At this point I’m mad because how can they send you a link on your phone to “save time” but then make you come inside to get your prescription?!?!?! Busy moms beg you to come up with a better solution! Until then, I will no longer get my prescriptions filled here (or shop here for that point).

name: JACK SMITH
text:
YOUR PHARMACY TECH JAIME DID A FANTASTIC JOB HELPING ME WITH MY DIABETIC SUPPLIES. I CANNOT SAY ENOUGH GOOD THINGS ABOUT HER. MY CVS PRESCRIPTIONS ARE NOW AT YOUR STORE.

THANKS AGAIN JAIME

JACK SMITH

name: Rebecca Sledge
text: The worst drugstore I've ever had.  You can never get the pharmacy on the phone.  I'm changing drugstores.

name: Joe Boxer
text: This location is awful. They Tell you one thing and then it ends up being something entirely different. Then no one wants to take accountability not even the manager.  It will have taken them six days to fill a prescription.

name: Randal Morris
text: Has down good discount items
